name: help
description: Print help

name: update
description: Check for updates and exit

name: verbose
description: Be verbose (optional argument: logging level)

name: preset
description: Use a built-in preset. Capitalization matters, and if the preset name has spaces, surround it with double quotation marks

name: preset-list
description: See a list of available built-in presets

name: no_dvd_nav
description: Do not use dvdnav for reading DVDs

name: no_open_cl
description: Disable use of OpenCL

name: input
description: Set input device

name: title
description: Select a title to encode (0 to scan all titles only

name: min-duration
description: Set the minimum title duration (in seconds). Shorter  titles will not be scanned.

name: scan
description: Scan selected title only.

name: main_feature
description: Detect and select the main feature title.

name: chapters
description: Select chapters (e.g. '1-3' for chapters 1 to 3, or '3' for chapter 3 only

name: angle
description: Select the video angle (DVD or Blu-ray only)

name: previews
description: Select how many preview images are generated, and whether or not they're stored to disk (0 or 1).

name: start_at_preview
description: Start encoding at a given preview.

name: start_at
description: Start encoding at a given frame, duration (in seconds), or pts (on a 90kHz clock)

name: stop_at
description: Stop encoding at a given frame, duration (in seconds), or pts (on a 90kHz clock)

name: output
description: Set output file name

name: format
description: Set output container format (av_mp4/av_mkv)

name: markers
description: Add chapter markers

name: large_file
description: Create 64-bit mp4 files that can hold more than 4 GB of data. Note: breaks pre-iOS iPod compatibility.

name: optimize
description: Optimize mp4 files for HTTP streaming ('fast start')

name: ipod_atom
description: Mark mp4 files so 5.5G iPods will accept them

name: use_open_cl
description: Use OpenCL where applicable

name: use_hwd
description: Use DXVA2 hardware decoding

name: encoder
description: Set video library encoder. Options: x264/x265/mpeg4/mpeg2/VP8/theora

name: encoder_preset
description: Adjust video encoding settings for a particular speed/efficiency tradeoff (encoder-specific)

name: encoder_preset_list
description: List supported --encoder-preset values for the specified video encoder

name: encoder_tune
description: Adjust video encoding settings for a particular  type of souce or situation (encoder-specific)

name: encoder_tune_list
description: List supported --encoder-tune values for the  specified video encoder

name: encopts
description: Specify advanced encoding options in the same  style as mencoder (all encoders except theora):  option1=value1:option2=value2

name: encoder_profile
description: Ensures compliance with the requested codec   profile (encoder-specific)

name: encoder_profile_list
description: List supported --encoder-profile values for the   specified video encoder

name: encoder_level
description: Ensures compliance with the requested codec  level (encoder-specific)

name: encoder_level_list
description: List supported --encoder-level values for the  specified video encoder

name: quality
description: Set video quality

name: video_bitrate
description: Set video bitrate

name: two_pass
description: Use two-pass mode

name: turbo
description: When using 2-pass use 'turbo' options on the  1st pass to improve speed (only works with x264)

name: video_framerate
description: Set video framerate (5/10/12/15/23.976/24/25/29.97/30/50/59.94/60).  Be aware that not specifying a framerate lets  HandBrake preserve a source's time stamps,  potentially creating variable framerate video

name: variable_framerate
description: VFR preserves the source timing.

name: constant_framerate
description: CFR makes the output constant rate at the rate given by the -r flag (or the source's average rate if no -r is given)

name: peak_limited_framerate
description: PFR doesn't allow the rate to go over the rate specified  with the -r flag but won't change the source  timing if it's below that rate.

name: audio_tracks
description: Select audio track(s), separated by commas

name: audio_encoder
description: Audio encoder(s): av_aac, fdk_aac, fdk_haac, copy:aac, ac3, copy:ac3, copy:dts, copy:dtshd, mp3, copy:mp3, vorbis, flac16, flac24, copy. copy:* will passthrough the corresponding audio unmodified to the muxer if it is a supported passthrough audio type. Separated by commas for more than one audio track.

name: audio_copy_mask
description: Set audio codecs that are permitted when the 'copy' audio encoder option is specified (aac/ac3/dts/dtshd/mp3, default: all).

name: audio_fallback
description: Set audio codec to use when it is not possible to copy an audio track without re-encoding.

name: audio_bitrate
description: Set audio bitrate(s) (default: depends on the selected codec, mixdown and samplerate). Separated by commas for more than one audio track.

name: audio_quality
description: Set audio quality metric (default: depends on the selected codec). Separated by commas for more than one audio track.

name: audio_compression
description: Set audio compression metric (default: depends on the selected codec). Separated by commas for more than one audio track.

name: mixdown
description: Format(s) for audio downmixing/upmixing:, mono, left_only, right_only, stereo, dpl1, dpl2, 5point1, 6point1, 7point1, 5_2_lfe .Separated by commas for more than one audio track.

name: normalize_mix
description: Normalize audio mix levels to prevent clipping.  Separated by commas for more than one audio track.  0 = Disable Normalization (default)  1 = Enable Normalization

name: audio_samplerate
description: Set audio samplerate(s) (8/11.025/12/16/22.05/24/32/44.1/48 kHz). Separated by commas for more than one audio track.

name: dynamic_range_compression
description: Apply extra dynamic range compression to the audio, making soft sounds louder. Range is 1.0 to 4.0  (too loud), with 1.5 - 2.5 being a useful range. Separated by commas for more than one audio track.

name: gain
description: Amplify or attenuate audio before encoding.  Does  NOT work with audio passthru (copy). Values are in  dB.  Negative values attenuate, positive values  amplify. A 1 dB difference is barely audible.

name: audio_dither
description: Apply dithering to the audio before encoding. Separated by commas for more than one audio track.  Only supported by some encoders (fdk_aac/fdk_haac/flac16).  Options: auto (default),  none,  rectangular,   triangular,   triangular_hp,  triangular_ns

name: audio_track_name
description: Audio track name(s).  Separated by commas for more than one audio track.

name: width
description: Set picture width

name: height
description: Set picture height

name: crop
description: Set cropping values (default: autocrop)

name: loose_crop
description: Always crop to a multiple of the modulus. Specifies the maximum number of extra pixels which may be cropped (default: 15)

name: max_height
description: Set maximum height

name: max_width
description: Set maximum width

name: strict_anamorphic
description: Store pixel aspect ratio in video stream

name: loose_anamorphic
description: Store pixel aspect ratio with specified width

name: custom_anamorphic
description: Store pixel aspect ratio in video stream and directly control all parameters.

name: display_width
description: Set the width to scale the actual pixels to at playback, for custom anamorphic.

name: keep_display_aspect
description: Preserve the source's display aspect ratio when using custom anamorphic

name: pixel_aspect
description: Set a custom pixel aspect for custom anamorphic (--display-width and --pixel-aspect are mutually exclusive and the former will override the latter)

name: itu_par
description: Use wider, ITU pixel aspect values for loose and custom anamorphic, useful with underscanned sources

name: modulus
description: Set the number you want the scaled pixel dimensions to divide cleanly by. Does not affect strict anamorphic mode, which is always mod 2 (default: 16)

name: color_matrix
description: Set the color space signaled by the output. Values: 709, pal, ntsc, 601 (same as ntsc) (default: detected from source)

name: deinterlace
description: Unconditionally deinterlaces all frames  <fast/slow/slower/bob> or omitted (default settings)  or  <YM:FD>  (default 0:-1)

name: decomb
description: Selectively deinterlaces when it detects combing <fast/bob> or omitted (default settings) or  <MO:ME:MT:ST:BT:BX:BY:MG:VA:LA:DI:ER:NO:MD:PP:FD>  (default: 7:2:6:9:80:16:16:10:20:20:4:2:50:24:1:-1)

name: detelecine
description: Detelecine (ivtc) video with pullup filter. Note: this filter drops duplicate frames to restore the pre-telecine framerate, unless you specify a constant framerate (--rate 29.97) <L:R:T:B:SB:MP:FD> (default 1:1:4:4:0:0:-1)

name: denoise
description: Denoise video with hqdn3d filter <ultralight/light/medium/strong> or omitted (default settings) or <SL:SCb:SCr:TL:TCb:TCr> (default: 4:3:3:6:4.5:4.5)

name: nlmeans
description: Denoise video with nlmeans filter <ultralight/light/medium/strong> or omitted or <SY:OTY:PSY:RY:FY:PY:Sb:OTb:PSb:Rb:Fb:Pb:Sr:OTr:PSr:Rr:Fr:Pr> (default 8:1:7:3:2:0)

name: nimeans_tune
description: Tune nlmeans filter to content type. Note: only works in conjunction with presets ultralight/light/medium/strong. <none/film/grain/highmotion/animation> or omitted (default none)

name: deblock
description: Deblock video with pp7 filter (default 5:2)

name: rotate
description: Rotate image or flip its axes. Modes: (can be combined) 1 vertical flip, 2 horizontal flip, 4 rotate clockwise 90 degrees, Default: 3 (vertical and horizontal flip)

name: grayscale
description: Grayscale encoding

name: subtitle_track
description: Select subtitle track(s), separated by commas. More than one output track can be used for one input.  Example: '1,2,3' for multiple tracks. A special track name 'scan' adds an extra 1st pass.  This extra pass scans subtitles matching the language of the first audio or the language  selected by --native-language. The one that's only used 10 percent of the time or less is selected. This should locate subtitles for short foreign language segments. Best used in conjunction with --subtitle-forced.

name: subtitle_forced
description: Only display subtitles from the selected stream if the subtitle has the forced flag set. The values in 'string' are indexes into the subtitle list specified with '--subtitle'. Separated by commas for more than one subtitle track. Example: '1,2,3' for multiple tracks. If 'string' is omitted, the first track is forced.

name: subtitle_burned
description: Burn' the selected subtitle into the video track. If 'number' is omitted, the first track is burned. 'number' is an index into the subtitle list specified with '--subtitle'.

name: subtitle_default
description: Flag the selected subtitle as the default subtitle  to be displayed upon playback.  Setting no default means no subtitle will be automatically displayed. If 'number' is omitted, the first track is default. 'number' is an index into the subtitle list specified with '--subtitle'.

name: native_language
description: Specifiy your language preference. When the first audio track does not match your native language then select the first subtitle that does. When used in conjunction with --native-dub the audio track is changed in preference to subtitles. Provide the language's iso639-2 code (fre, eng, spa, dut, et cetera)

name: native_dub
description: Used in conjunction with --native-language requests that if no audio tracks are selected the default selected audio track will be the first one that matches the --native-language. If there are no matching audio tracks then the first matching subtitle track is used instead.

name: srt_file
description: SubRip SRT filename(s), separated by commas.

name: srt_codeset
description: Character codeset(s) that the SRT file(s) are encoded in, separated by commas. Use 'iconv -l' for a list of valid codesets. If not specified, 'latin1' is assumed

name: srt_offset
description: Offset (in milliseconds) to apply to the SRT file(s), separated by commas. If not specified, zero is assumed. Offsets may be negative.

name: srt_lang
description: Language as an iso639-2 code fra, eng, spa et cetera) for the SRT file(s), separated by commas. If not specified, then 'und' is used.

name: srt_default
description: Flag the selected srt as the default subtitle to be displayed upon playback.  Setting no default means no subtitle will be automatically displayed. If 'number' is omitted, the first srt is default. 'number' is an 1 based index into the srt-file list

name: srt_burn
description: Burn' the selected srt subtitle into the video track. If 'number' is omitted, the first srt is burned. 'number' is an 1 based index into the srt-file list
